Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries

Source: R/get_gb_meta.R
get_gb_meta.Rd

This function returns metadadata of the geoBoundaries API.

Usage

get_gb_meta(
  country = "ALL",
  adm_lvl = c("ALL", "ADM0", "ADM1", "ADM2", "ADM3", "ADM4"),
  release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative")
)

Source

geoboundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

Arguments

country

A character vector of country codes. It could be either "ALL" (that would return the data for all countries), a vector of country names or a vector of ISO3 country codes. Mixed types (as c("Italy","ES","FRA")) would not work. See also countrycode::countrycode().

adm_lvl

Type of boundary Accepted values are "ALL" (all available boundaries) or the ADM level ("ADM0" is the country boundary, "ADM1" is the first level of sub national boundaries, "ADM2" is the second level and so on.

release_type

One of "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". Source of the spatial data. See Details.

Value

A tibble.

Details

Equivalent to get_gb(..., metadata = TRUE). See Details in get_gb().

See also

get_gb()

Examples

# Get ADM4 levels

library(dplyr)

get_gb_meta(adm_lvl = "ADM4") %>%
  glimpse()
